chapter.title: Community support
chapter.para: Many technologies and companies have a presence on the Internet for support and interaction between between users and developers. This model of community support is particularly relevant for RTC technology. RTC, by definition, requires interoperability between all those using the technology and efficient online collaboration helps to identify and resolve interoperability problems. Many users also have common problems to solve, such as the collaboration between Internet companies to eliminate spam.

In the RTC domain, there are a range of online communities with various objectives. The objectives include supporting specific pieces of software, development of standards, discussion of operational issues between providers and advocacy of open standards and private communication.

sect2.title: Major announcements
sect2.para:
The
Free-RTC-Announce mailing list is a low-volume mailing list where you can receive important announcements about Free RTC products, community activities and events. The list is fully moderated and aims not to send more than one announcement per week. Please go ahead and subscribe now.

sect2.title: Strategy and advocacy
sect2.para: The FSFE Free RTC mailing list discusses strategies for promoting and adopting free RTC and free software.

sect2.title: Collaboration between operators and service providers
sect2.para: The XSF XMPP operators mailing list enables discussion of issues between organizations managing XMPP servers of any size.

sect2.title: Server support
sect2.para:
The
reSIProcate repro users mailing list provides community support for people setting up and operating the repro SIP proxy server.
The Prosody users mailing list provides community support for people setting up and operating the Prosody XMPP server.

sect2.title: Softphones
sect2.para: The Lumicall users mailing list supports users of the Lumicall Android app.
The Jitsi users mailing list provides a resource for those setting up and using the Jitsi products, including the popular Jitsi softphone.

sect1.title: Popular blogs and news sites
sect1.para: planet.sip5060.net syndicates blogs from leading software developers with a focus on RTC and especially SIP.
